Creative Computing Projects

October 2020 - February 2020

Reactive Music Player

A music player which reacts to the variations of the audio track's frequencies. For this project I used the p5.js Fast Fourier Transform method to determine the lines' height and color based on the music. The colorful circles are part of a particles sytem implemented with Javascript ES6 classes. They move following a Perlin's noise pattern and change direction if they hit the circumference. Click on the play button to vibe some Flume and see how it works!

Particles Links

While learning about particles systems using Javascript ES6 classes and Perlin's noise in p5.js I tried to make a network of such particles. In order to do so, I calculated the euclidean distance between each pair of particles and drawn a line between them if the distance was less than a given threshold. As you can see the lines' color intensity and stroke weight are mapped on its length.
What you see below is the p5.js sketch running live on inside your browser.

Particles Smoke

Particles smoke is the direct child of the particles links project. Here kept the Perlin's noise moving pattern and the lins between the particles. This time though, I made the particles invisible, stopped the background from continuosly redrawing itself and lowered a lot the links' opacity in order to achieve a painting effect.
